page.title: 02Congresbury
page.content:
The area we studied lies mainly to the south of the A 370 road from Bristol to Weston-super-Mare between the small village of Hewish and the larger village of Congresbury. It also includes the hamlet of Puxton.
The area is almost exclusively farmland. It is mainly very flat pasture and has to be drained. This is because it is watered by the Congresbury Yeo River which is very slow running. The villages are mainly devoted to farming with the exception of Congresbury which is a commuter village. Congresbury has a population of 3524 and Puxton just 215
